thig10.1:1.1: Monastic giving instructions to Kisāgotami? Or is it all her own monologue?
thig10.1:4.1: This does not seem to be a direct quote of the Buddha, since it does not appear anywhere else in the Suttas. Nonetheless, the Buddha did often state that *any* state of being is dukkha, whether in the form of a woman or a man or anything else.
thig10.1:8.1: I take this to be the instruction of the same monastic at the beginning of the poem to Kisāgotamī.
thig10.1:9.1: Here it is clearly Kīsagotamī speaking declaring enlightenment.
